Articles.Content:
I was running an asteroid rendezvous mission, and all of a sudden the game started crashing. First it crashed just shy of CLAW contact, then, after a restart, it crashed again while I was trying to EVA to the rock, then a couple more times afterwards, while I was trying to timewarp to make the capture, now it crashes on the first load to the space center, even after a restart.

I am running tons of mods, and x64, so it could be anything, I thought I'd post some of the logs to see if anyone thought the game was fixable.

https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/18212815/2014-10-29_224832.rar

64 bit windows? If so I would start their and go back to 32 bit. Again if usings windows system.

Other than that nothing we can do for people trying to use unstable 64bit windows ksp.

That's it?

That doesn't help at all. You won't even look at my logs? Reverting to 32bit is an absolute last resort.
You have so many mods installed that 32bit KSP even crashes with OpenGl enabled?
I haven't tried open GL, but I am pretty sure I have more then 3.5 GB of mods.
There is nothing that can be done by you or I to fix x64; that's why Squad warned you it was unstable before you could download it, let alone before you could run it.

Yeah, I got that when the warning popped up in the load screen, I'm not trying to be rude or anything, I just want to rule out any other possible causes before I blame it on x64. To this point, my install has been very stable, and hasn't suffered any other crashes I couldn't attribute to some mod or another.

At least I'd like to know what not to do to avoid this crash in the future (aside from not using x64:P).

Edited October 30, 2014 by Capt. Hunt
